result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett J. Keever was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--DNA sample not ordered due to date of conviction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett J. Keever

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD - Bond posted at Fond du Lac County Jail
JFFO & NOC mailed to Defendant - Unable to Fwd.
RN mailed to defendant - Unable to Fwd.
with Elements and Criminal Case Settlement Attached

Cases 15CM26 & 15CM272 called together at 11:36 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Brett J. Keever in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek submits custody credit worksheet along with plea paperwork

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-15CM26 & 15CM272; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

On Count #1-15CM26, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges
--24 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243; due in $35 increments per month beginning 3/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 5 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to be in payment plan with case 15CM272.
--DNA Sample and Surcharge not ordered due to date of violation
TIME SERVED SENTENCE

On Count #1-15CM272, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence concurrent to Count #1-15CM26  
--22 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $443 (includes DNA); due in $35 increments per month beginning 3/1/16 and on the 1st day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 5 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive to be on payment plan with 15CM26.
--DNA sample not ordered due to date of violation
TIME SERVED SENTENCE
Recess: 12:03 pm
Defendant appeared in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

Cases 15CM26 called at 1:36 pm [sf]
Defendant Brett J. Keever in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews warrant was issued by Judge Netteshiem.
Attorney De La Rosa advises that the defendant remains a Jefferson County residence and that he turned himself in on this warrant.

Court requires $500.00 CASH  bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--attend a status review on 

Atty De La Rosa advises the defendant remains eligible for SPD representation.


15CM272 called at 1:39 pm

Address and DOB information verified by the Court or DOB verified. New Address information provided.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $150.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
-No contact with Rylee O'Donnell


Recess: 1:42 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 1/20/16 at 8:20 am (15CM272)
Status: 1/28/16 at 9:00 am (15CM26 & 15CM272)

 Defendant Brett J. Keever in court with attorney  Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
